result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrea C McElroy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay $100.00 fine plus costs.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

Defendant Andrea C McElroy in court with attorney Anthony Flitcroft.  Cody John Horlacher appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion deadline 02-01-16. Bond Remains. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Original Warrant filed with the court.

Defendant Andrea C McElroy in court with attorney Anthony Flitcroft.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant Quashed. Bond Reinstated. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Anthony Flitcroft appeared.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not appear. Court orders warrant and bond forfeited. Minutes filed.
Defendant does not appear. Attorney Anthony Flitcroft appeared.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders warrant and bond forfeiture. Minutes filed.
Atty Anthony Flitcroft has been appointed to Andrea C. McElroy on 07/22/15
Defendant Andrea C McElroy in court with attorney .  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered. Minutes Filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH Z.P. OR HIS RESIDENCE.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 15-2583 thru 15-2586
Defendant in court in custody with Atty Schwantes and Mr. Malkus. Atty Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes Filed.
